intro: Aster catalaunicus, commonly known as the Catalan aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped foliage. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, appearing in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
